FuncDef:
The evpn command creates an EVPN instance for a VXLAN.
The undo evpn command deletes an EVPN instance of a VXLAN. The evpn command creates an EVPN instance for a VXLAN. The undo evpn command deletes an EVPN instance of a VXLAN. By default, no EVPN instance is created for VXLANs. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ExtraInfo: The created EVPN instance can store EVPN routes sent from peer VTEPs.
